CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, July 8, 1944, pg. 10 reads: "Out-Of-Towners At Wedding - Snapped at the pre-nuptial rehearsal dinner for the Stanton-Taylor wedding in Pittsburgh, given by a group of aides at the Oakmont home of Mrs. R.L. Vann, were this group of out-of-towners. Seated are Miss Alice Batch, D.C.; the groom's mother, Mrs. R.R. Taylor of Wilmington, N.C.; aunt, Mrs. A.U. Craig, Fine Creek Mills, Va., and Mrs. Lucille Fisk of Charleston, W. Va.  Standing: The bride's uncle, Joseph Stanton of Detroit; Mrs. Robert Taylor and Mr. Taylor, the groom's brother and sister-in-law, of Chicago; Mrs. Joseph Robinson, Albany, N.Y.; James H. Law, Houston, Tex.; Mrs. M.V. Boutte of New York City, and Dr. Joseph Robinson, Albany."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait, from left, seated: Alice Batch, Mrs. R.R. Taylor, Mrs. A.U. Craig, and Lucille Fisk; standing: Joseph Stanton, Mrs. Robert Taylor and Mr. Taylor, Mrs. Joseph Robinson, James H. Law, Mrs. M.V. Boutte, and Dr. Joseph Robinson, gathered in home of Jessie Vann for Stanton -Taylor wedding rehearsal dinner, another version
